column2: While sitting on the bus he saw her standing on the corner.Her beauty was like none he'd ever seen.As he walked off the bus he wondered if he should have pursued her.He slowly took the elevator to his tenth story office.
column3: He thought about her all day.

column2: My daughter had been begging for a pet.Her birthday was coming up.I visited the pet store to do some research.The workers helped me make a decision.
column3: I bought her a dog.

column2: Last Friday I ate lunch with my niece.We went to a restaurant that had a jungle theme.My niece was excited because the restaurant was so cool.We ate our meals, and shared a dessert.
column3: The restaurant was just too cold.

column2: I ordered a family meal at a Chinese restaurant.As soon as I placed it on the table, my family attacked it.They were eating a lot out of the meal.After everyone ate, there was no food left.
column3: I told the manager I wanted to file a complaint.

column2: Gina needed a blanket for her picnic.She wanted a red gingham one.The closest she could find was her mom's bedspread.She pulled if off the bed and took it to the yard.
column3: Gina threw it away.

column2: Robert and Sharon met at band camp when they were in high school.By the time they graduated they had plans to marry.Now they are expecting their first great grandchild.Sharon can't believe that so much time passed so fast.
column3: But she is as happy today as she was the day they met.

column2: Randy wanted to get a dog so bad.Randy's mom was allergic to dogs.Randy asked if he could move in with his dad.His dad said yes.
column3: Randy bought a lizard with his dad.

column2: Today was Pinwheels for Peace Day.My teacher took the class towards the front of the school.Everyone planted pinwheels near the stop.When we looked at the wheels from afar, they were spinning.
column3: Our teacher took a photo of the pinwheels.

column2: Ava needed to go shopping with her two-year old.But she couldn't find his shoes even after looking everywhere!She decided she had no choice but to buy him new shoes.She carried him into the store in order to select a new pair.
column3: Ava took good care of her son.

column2: Max had been dating Maddie for three Year's.He had never met her family.He felt very suspicious and told Maddie he wanted to meet them.Maddie was worried because she had a secret.
column3: Maddie couldn't wait for Max to meet her family.

column2: Mia loved being outdoors.One summer, she decided to go mountain climbing.She joined a club of people who climbed mountains together.They climbed the tallest mountain in her area.
column3: Mia wished she could be indoors.

column2: Everyday, I nag my daughter to do her homework.I finally decided that it is her own responsibility.Sure enough, she didn't do it one evening.I sent her to bed anyway, knowing she would get in trouble at school.
column3: She ended up making a bad grade on the assignment.

column2: Jane went on a walk.On the walk, she passed an animal shelter.She saw an adorable dog staring back at her in the window.Jane went in and instantly bonded well with the dog.
column3: She asked the shelter worker about adopting the dog.

column2: I had to write an analysis paper for English.I read the source material over and over.I thought about it very hard.Then, I wrote my analysis paper.
column3: I decided to delete the finished paper.

column2: Gina had tons of missed texts.She hadn't checked her phone for 2 days.She checked half of the messages, and decided to come back later.When she checked again there were texts from her friends.
column3: Gina turned off her phone because she didn't have any texts.

column2: My parents fell out of love.I'm not sure when it happened but it seems to have been mutual.They decided to end things amicably.Although I'm hurt by this I'm glad they chose what makes them happy.
column3: My parents want to live together.

column2: Henry wanted to play a scavenger hunt for his son's birthday party.A list of items to retrieve was created first.He turned to neighbors and nearby businesses for help.After placing items in appropriate places he had to create the hints.
column3: Henry decided not to do the scavenger hunt.

column2: Amy was excited it was Christmas Eve.She had been very good all year.She gave the list of her favorite toys to Santa at the mall.He told her she would receive everything she wanted.
column3: On Christmas, Amy got exactly what she hoped to get.

column2: Sally is a writer.She signed up to write a story.There was a very specific set of instructions included.Unfortunately, she did not read the directions.
column3: Sally failed in her efforts to complete the assignment.

column2: Oscar was a wrestler in high school and practiced every day.During practice he got sweat from other people on him.He ended up coming down with ringworm on his left hand.He went to the doctor to get medicine.
column3: Oscar wrestled his doctor to the floor.

column2: Gina and her siblings were in the house looking out the window.In the yard her dad and his friends were fighting.The fight was violent and scary.Gina shooed the kids away from the windows.
column3: The kids were scared.

column2: Jill was playing video games with her sister.Jill was angry that she was losing every game.Jill took her game controller and threw it at the TV.The TV screen cracked right down the center.
column3: Jill got better at video games.

column2: My sister in law is an elephant lover.She collected 100 elephant figurines.Lately she grew tired of her collection.She had me try to sell the figurines on eBay.
column3: My sister in law bought more elephants.

column2: Trouble comes when folks do not listen.My daughter did not listen to me today.She was dancing too close to the wall.She lost control and hit the corner of the wall.
column3: I bought my daughter some ice cream for listening so well.

column2: It was the last day of our vacation.We were eating lunch on the patio of the hotel.We laughed and smiled because it was a great vacation.Then we packed our bags and drove to the airport.
column3: We want to revisit someday.

column2: My wife was coming home early from work last night.I decided to make sandwiches.She usually enjoys them quite a bit.She didn't come home when she said she would.
column3: I kept the sandwiches in the refrigerator until she arrived.

column2: Tom was studying for the big test.He then fell asleep do to boredom.He slept for five hours.He woke up shocked.
column3: Tom felt prepared for the test.

column2: Derek was driving at night.Suddenly his car buckled and he was forced to pull over.There was smoke coming from under the hood.He noticed this and got out of the car quickly.
column3: He walked away, and never looked back.

column2: Mario got up out of bed.Today was his wedding day and he already felt the butterflies.He shaved and showered happily.He got dressed and went to the church.
column3: It was the best day of his life.

column2: Matt was driving home one night.He wasn't paying attention.He struck and injured a jogger who crossed the road.Matt was horrified and stopped to check on her.
column3: Matt fiddled with the car radio, looking for a better station.

column2: Jill convinced her boyfriend Joe to go look for Geocache with her.He didn't think it sounded like fun but decided to humor her.They searched the location where the Geocache was supposed to be.After over an hour of searching they were unable to find it.
column3: Jill was glad she did not bring Joe.

column2: Year's ago I wondered what was my life's purpose.I volunteered my for services for many social organizations.I learned I like helping people bring about change.I discovered I wanted to help resolve many of the world's problems.
column3: I became a shark on Wall Street.

column2: One day, my computer mouse stopped working.I went to the store to buy a new one.Every mouse I found was too expensive.I went home and decided to try and fix my mouse.
column3: I was successful.

column2: Heather and Marcus were ready for the next step in their relationship.They were happy newlyweds, but wanted an addition to their family.Although not quite ready for kids, they still felt lonely.On a whim, they went to an animal shelter and fell in love with a cat.
column3: They left the shelter without an animal.

column2: Joe went fishing.He sat by the river a long time.Suddenly his pole went down.Joe jumped to his feet.
column3: He grabbed the pole and pulled out a huge flounder.

column2: Last Saturday I decided to volunteer at the nursing home.To my surprise it was very fun.I played some checkers with the folks and read to them.The residents seemed to enjoy my company greatly.
column3: I plan to go back every week.

column2: A man dug a well on his farm.Instead of water, though, he struck oil.Jubilant, he placed some calls.A large oil company arrived the next day.
column3: The oil company never arrived.

column2: Eric was walking around a pond at a local park.He saw a turtle on a rock a few feet from the shore.He stepped into the water to try to catch the turtle.Suddenly, he sank knee deep into the mud and got stuck.
column3: Someone walking on the shore ran over to rescue Eric.

column2: Irene was taking part in the school play.She wanted to be an actress but she did not get any roles.So the director offered to let her design costumes.Irene accepted, and found that she loved the work!
column3: Irene felt proud seeing her costumes on stage.

column2: Ken was on vacation in the tropics.He was learning to scuba dive.He passed his certification course and then dived every day.Soon he was learning lots of facts about the ocean and exploring.
column3: He was scared of the water.

column2: Robbie was looking for help shoveling her car out of the snow.She posted on Facebook, hoping somebody would see.Cameron saw the post, and felt sympathy for Robbie and her car.Since he had the day off work, Cameron said he could help.
column3: Cameron came by and helped Robbie shovel.

column2: Mariko took her friend Julie to try ramen.Julie had never had ramen that wasn't instant dry noodles before.She eagerly tried the ramen.It was so good, she ordered a second bowl.
column3: She poured the contents into the garbage and washed the bowl.

column2: John was really bored at work one day.He decided to order a huge amount of marshmallows from online.He also bought a marshmallow gun.He spent hours shooting marshmallows at the birds outside his house.
column3: John collected the marshmallows to eat afterwards.

column2: Julie was a scientist who worked for a university.She received a call from another professor.The professor asked her to be part of his expedition to the jungle.Julie found a flower that she had never seen before.
column3: Julie threw the flower into the river.

column2: Johnny's girlfriend was sad.Every day she had painful migraines.Eventually it got so bad that Johnny took her to the doctor.They assigned her pills to help her with her migranes.
column3: The migraines lessened their intensity.

column2: Ronald had two kids, a boy and a girl.That was more than enough.He really didn't want two to be honest.One day his wife told him baby three was on the way.
column3: His eyes glowed with excitement.

column2: Sue had a sore throat.She didn't know what to do.She took cough drops and that didn't work.She made hot tea, and that didn't stop the soreness.
column3: Sue made an appointment with the doctor as a last resort.

column2: I had saw a bunny On craigslist.I called to go an pick her up.We arrived at the house.I saw my new bunny for the first time.
column3: I decided to take the bunny to a pet store.

column2: Jeb liked peppermint candy.He always had peppermints in his pocket.One day, he saw a pretty girl buying peppermints in the store.He decided it was a sign and boldly asked her out on the spot.
column3: Jeb got the date but never ate peppermints again.

column2: It was a bright, warm day.So Joe thought it would be nice to take a walk.He decided to walk to his local coffee shop.But halfway there, he started getting tired.
column3: So he ran to the coffee shop.

column2: James woke up and was in a bad mood immediately.He went too fix breakfast and burnt his toast.Then went to get dressed and couldn't find any socks.James decided it was a bad day and he was going back to bed.
column3: James woke up later and felt much better.

column2: Beth asked Amy to skip 4th period and go to McDonalds for lunch.Amy was hesitant but agreed to go.While at McDonald's Amy's band teacher walked in.He took the girls to the principal's office.
column3: They were suspended for a day.

column2: Jan was having a birthday trip in Hawaii.She was super excited to have some fun.Her best friend Kristin was disappointed she was not invited.Kristen tried asking Jan if she could be invited.
column3: Jan decided not to invite anyone on her birthday trip.

column2: In college, I had some terrible professors.They did not know how to teach the students.So, I learned to teach myself on my own.Instead of going to class, I went to the library and did exactly that.
column3: Teaching myself helped me get ahead of other students.

column2: Sue was hungry.She went to the refrigerator and cupboard in search of food.She saw that she had no food.She found her jacket, purse, and keys.
column3: Sue drove to a hamburger joint.

column2: I was buying a magazine the other day.The price came out to more than I had.It was off by only a few cents.The stand didn't accept debit cards.
column3: The news agent told me to give him the rest of the money later.

column2: Neil loved visiting Romania!Transylvania was lovely even though he saw no vampires.But his favorite stop was Bucharest!The Romanian capital was vibrant and lively.
column3: Neil had a great time.

column2: Emile wanted to be a great chef.He took lessons and worked hard learning how to cook.He practiced his cooking and served food for friends.His friends loved his cooking and encouraged him.
column3: Emile eventually got a job as a chef.

column2: Kathy desired to be a Physical Therapist since she was in high school.In college, she took many classes and applied for graduate school.After a period of waiting, she finally received her acceptance email!She made her way through schooling and graduated with her degree.
column3: Kathy decided to become a sushi chef.

column2: Brad was sick with a cold!He wanted to go out and play!He was too weak to move.His mother gave him soup and medicine.
column3: Brad's mother was rather uncaring.

column2: The cop pulled me over at night.He said I had been speeding.He went back to his car.I waited with the lights flashing behind me.
column3: I hoped he would just give me a warning.

column2: Maggie had her first piano recital tonight.She was very nervous.When she got on stage she was shaking.Thankfully she ended up playing perfectly.
column3: Maggie gave up the piano.

column2: Neil took a tour to the taj Mahal.He admired the beautiful design of it.Then he heard the sad story behind it.Neil was impressed by the obvious labor of love.
column3: Neil was glad he had seen the taj Mahal.

column2: Sara wanted her kids to have a great Christmas.She saved all year and started her shopping in November.She shopped deals and spent all her savings.She spent two days wrapping dozens of presents.
column3: She returned all of the presents for cheaper ones.

column2: Amy was scared of going to the doctor.The pediatrician was very patient with her and shared her stethoscope.Amy found it very interesting and wasn't scared anymore.Amy decided she wanted to be a doctor when she grew up.
column3: Amy actually grew up to be a successful doctor.

column2: Abigail keeps a strict schedule.She takes a walk in the morning and at night.She walks for about 30 minutes at a time around the neighborhood.Sometimes she even takes her dog Dexter.
column3: Abigail climbed off her wheelchair and onto the bed.

column2: Ava started to notice wrinkles by her eyes.She bought an expensive wrinkle cream.She applied it every night.After a month she checked her eyes out carefully.
column3: She was happy to see her wrinkles were gone.

column2: My dad took me to a baseball game when I was little.He spent that night teaching me all about the sport.He showed me every position and what everything meant.He introduced me to one of my favorite games ever.
column3: I can't sit through an entire baseball game without boredom.

column2: Cara wanted new kitchen cabinets.She told her husband.He looked at how-to videos.He decided it looked like a simple enough job.
column3: Cara's husband decided to go back to college.

column2: Bertha wanted to get a haircut.However, she was undecided on how to cut her hair.Bertha had a idea to go to a wig store.At the wig store Bertha tried on different wigs.
column3: Bertha bought a jump rope.

column2: I went to a renaissance fair with my friends.At the fair, there was a petting zoo!We went inside to see the animals.I got to pet so many wonderful animals.
column3: I decided I hated animals and never returned to the zoo.

column2: Tom always wanted to be a singer.He's been practicing since he was 5 years old.He auditioned for american idol and got in.The hosts all liked his voice.
column3: Tom was so disappointed.

column2: John took Sarah out on a first date at a restaurant.He ordered her his favorite entree, a pork dish.Sarah took a bite and her face swelled up.She asked if there was pineapple in the dish.
column3: He said yes.

column2: Stacey was going to the store.Her mother told her to take an umbrella just in case.Stacey said it wasn't necessary.Sure enough it started to rainy while she was at the store.
column3: She wished she'd listened to her mother's advice.

column2: Sandy is Louie's mother.Louie is a puppy.A nice family adopted Sandy.They decided to adopt Louie too.
column3: The dogs seemed happy to stay together.

column2: My old neighbor used to take Halloween too far.His costumes were very elaborate.One year, he decided to be Jason and hide under his garage door.He scared everyone, and the whole neighborhood complained.
column3: The next year he didn't dress up at all.

column2: John was driving to the store when he realized he forgot his wallet.His driver's license was in the wallet.Police lights started flashing behind him.After pulling over he told the officer he forgot his wallet at home.
column3: John then proceeded to assault the officer.

column2: Caroline heard frantic scratching on her door during a rainy storm.Caroline opened the door, and saw a lost kitten.Caroline brought the kitten inside and took care of him.Caroline decided to keep the kitten.
column3: Caroline refers diet soda.

column2: My friend and I decided to start a band and perform for our families.I was singer and my friend played guitar.We practiced in my garage.Eventually, we got pretty good.
column3: We stopped playing in a band together.

column2: I invited a girl I like to the movies last week.She said yes.We decided to watch a comedy.It was pretty funny.
column3: I felt very sad while watching the film.

column2: Fred's boss called him into the office at the propane filling station.He told Fred that times were tough and he had to be laid off.Fred became very angry about this.He picked up his boss by the collar and threw him down.
column3: Fred's boss gave him a large hug.

column2: Japan was preparing for the biggest tsunami of the year.They were gathering supplies for it.Eventually it came and crashed down.It destroyed hundreds of houses.
column3: People found the storm invigorating.

column2: A police officer came down with the flu today.He was unable to go into work as he could barely get out of bed.His wife spent time taking care of him and making sure he was okay.He made sure to drink enough and eat enough.
column3: The police officer eventually got better.

column2: Yesterday I played the Powerball game.I picked my numbers from our family's bible.I purchased my tickets from a reputable online lottery agent.I prayed nervously as the winning numbers were drawn.
column3: I didn't win.

column2: Lewy loved tractors.One day he decided to build one.He went to the scrap yard for parts.Next he took them home.
column3: Lewy decided to throw all the worthless tractor parts away.

column2: Sometimes my kids wondered if Santa Claus was real.Each year we left cookies and milk for him on Christmas Eve.Each Christmas day we found an empty cup and cookie crumbs.One year we found cookie pieces outside in the snow.
column3: We told the kids it was thanksgiving.

column2: Jane was selling chocolate bars for high school band.She carried the chocolate in her backpack, but forgot to sell them.She often ate a bar after school, or during lunch.She realized the money for the bars were due, and she had eaten them!
column3: Jane was proud of what she had done.

column2: Oliver was nervous about his wedding.He was worried that he would stutter during the vows.When the time came, he took a deep breath and began to speak.He stuttered, but his wife smiled and hugged him and he was okay.
column3: Oliver was so grateful for his wife's love.

column2: When I was young I loved hide and sneak.I would play it even when others didn't know.I would just hide and jump out at people.I did this all the time in elementary school.
column3: People were very happy when I played this game without them.

column2: Harry went to the theme park with his family.His dad and brother rode on a big roller coaster with him.He then rode on some smaller rides with his mom.The family ate at a restaurant at the park.
column3: Harry didn't like theme parks.

column2: A plumber was called over to fix a leaky sink.He took out his tools and got to work.The problem was that two pipes did not fit together perfectly.The plumber replaced one of the old pipes with a newer pipe that fit.
column3: The sink was not repaired.

column2: Ellen dreamed of winning a prize for her roses.She planned to enter her special purple rose at the fair.She fertilized the rose bush and covered it each night.The roses grew more beautiful every day.
column3: Ellen ended up winning the prize.

column2: Stewart and his sister were fighting over the TV remote.Their parents yelled at them to stop, but the kids persisted.During a tug of war over the remote, it flew out of their hands.The remote smashed into the TV screen, resulting in a big crack.
column3: Stewart and his sister parents congratulated them.

column2: My neighbors are always playing loud music.It's not so bad during the day.They also play it at night, unfortunately.I finally asked them if they could lower the volume.
column3: They told me that they hadn't seen my cat.

column2: Jayne visited Alden, New york.Her uncle owned a farm there.She helped care for the animals.Then she helped harvest the veggies from the garden.
column3: Jayne decided to set fire to the garden and destroy the farm.

column2: My sister in law is trying to save money.She is a recent widow living on a pension.She recently returned two of three cable boxes.I told her that antennas work well now that broadcasts are HD.
column3: She was glad to hear that.

column2: Olivia went out with Harry on a date.Harry thought the date was going well.Olivia thinks he is a complete jerk.Harry raves about their chemistry.
column3: Olivia feels she is falling in love.

column2: I was feeling ill.I scheduled a doctor's appointment.I went to see the doctor.He ran some tests.
column3: I found out I had the flu.

column2: Pam left her son with a new babysitter.She told her that her son was allergic to peanut butter.But the babysitter gave him peanut butter oatmeal.The babysitter had to call the hospital.
column3: Pam was impressed with the babysitter.

column2: Suzy went to the ice cream store.She ordered a vanilla milkshake.When she tried to pay the man for her milkshake, he smiled at her.He told her that she won a special contest.
column3: He gave her the milkshake for free.

column2: Jim's car was ten Year's old, and started having problems.He decided to trade it in and buy a new one.He did a lot of research on the most economical cars to buy.He decided on one that could also run on a battery.
column3: Jim decided that he would rather buy a bike instead of a car.

column2: Hailey was participating in her school marathon.However she forgot to bring her running shoes.Hailey was still determined.She asked her teacher if she could borrow her's for the day.
column3: The teacher admired Haley's passion and agreed.

column2: Yolanda hates roller coasters.Katie does not understand why.She decided to force Yolanda to ride one with her.Yolanda vomited all over Katie.
column3: Katie was the happiest she had ever been.

column2: Tyler needed some extra spending money.He began looking for after school jobs.Finally he found a job at the local cafe.He makes coffee and bagels for customers.
column3: He had fun golfing.

column2: Bill saved all his pocket change for 2 weeks last month.It was for a sucker from the store.He brought all his chance and bought the sucker.Walking home he tripped and fell.
column3: Bill was sad to see the sucker covered with dirt on the ground.

column2: Sam loved breakfast.He particularly loved frozen waffles.He would make four of them every morning when he woke up.When he woke up this morning three were in the box, not four.
column3: Sam ate three waffles this morning.

column2: James was having a girl over for dinner.He was excited but nervous about cooking a meal.After looking up recipes, he went to the store and got ingredients.He went home and cooked a very nice meal for two.
column3: James was proud of himself.

column2: Jackie has been designated eighth grade hall monitor.She is envied throughout the class.Classmates often put her job in jeopardy.They would steal Jackie's hall passes.
column3: Her classmates were given awards for their behavior.

column2: Riley was not very popular at school.She wore funny clothes.One day, her friend suggested they do makeovers.Riley agreed to make herself over.
column3: Riley stopped being friends.

column2: Eddie's dad took him to a wrestling show.Eddie loved the whole show!Afterwards, he got a wrestler's autograph.He decided wrestlers were the best guys ever.
column3: Eddie had the best day with his dad!

column2: Lee knew her mom needed new gloves and could not afford them.So Lee began to knit a pair.She hurried to finish them by Christmas.Then she presented them to her mom.
column3: Lee's mom threw the gloves at Lee and left the room.

column2: I bought a new car today.It is shiny and red.The inside smells so fresh and clean.I love the car so much.
column3: I drive the car everywhere I go.

column2: Jack went on a trip to the store.He really needed to buy some eggs.He looked everywhere but could not find them!He asked the clerk where they were.
column3: The clerk told him to find the eggs.

column2: Ken met a nice man online, and they decided to go on a date.They met at a nice restaurant and shook hands.Ken and his date ordered food and had small talk.While they ate, Ken decided that he really liked the man.
column3: Ken made an excuse to leave quickly.

column2: Beth started collecting dolls.She bought dolls online and at flea markets and antique shops.Soon Beth's house was full of dolls.When a friend came to visit, there was no room to chat in the house.
column3: They had to move the dolls to sit down.

column2: Tiffany bought a bag of microwave popcorn.She didn't read the directions.She put the bag in the microwave and pushed the popcorn button.Minutes later she smelled something horrible.
column3: The popcorn had burned because she left it in too long.

column2: Hannah had a beautiful cat that she loved very much.However, she noticed that her cat was getting very old.One day, her cat ran away and never came back.Hannah was devastated.
column3: She found her cat hidden under the couch.

column2: Harry had a big crush on Mary.He asked her out on a date one evening.Mary told him that she wasn't interested.Harry was saddened by her response.
column3: He became very depressed.

column2: I was at the bar with some friends.It was my turn to buy a round.I went up to the bartender and asked him for 13 beers and a shot.He asked for my card and took my order.
column3: He filled my order.

column2: John bought a new gun.He loved all the safety features.He was showing it off to his friend.It accidentally went off.
column3: John did not have a gun.

column2: We all went on vacation to Vermont.We went to different maple syrup farms.We tried different cheeses at cheese factories.But our favorite part was the trip to Ben and Jerry's.
column3: We all love ice cream.

column2: Eric was helping his dad clear a wooded area.They were going to put a picnic table there.All of a sudden he was swarmed by bees.He had accidentally disturbed their nest.
column3: The bees did not bother Eric.

column2: Everyday, I nag my daughter to do her homework.I finally decided that it is her own responsibility.Sure enough, she didn't do it one evening.I sent her to bed anyway, knowing she would get in trouble at school.
column3: She played basketball with her friends all afternoon.

column2: Rachel really wanted some new make-up.However, she lacked money to purchase some.She went to the store and slipped some eyeliner into her purse.She walked out of the store without anyone catching her.
column3: Rachel threw the eyeliner into the trash.

column2: Tom was making some pasta.He boiled some water.He left the kitchen to answer an important phone call.When he came back there was water all over the ground.
column3: He had forgotten to turn the stove on.

column2: Today, Jane made a salad.The salad had spinach, goat cheese and cranberries.Jane drizzled balsamic over the top.She shared her salad with her sister.
column3: Jane drove a car to the city.

column2: Tom and Susan have been married for eight Year's.For the last week Susan has been nauseated every morning.This morning she took a pregnancy test which was positive.Susan planned a fancy dinner with candles to tell Tom the good news.
column3: She never told Tom.

column2: Cindy got out of bed.But she couldn't find her slippers.Instead of making breakfast, spent all day looking for them.She gave up and ordered another pair.
column3: Luckily, the new ones were more comfortable than the old ones.

column2: Lindsey was feeling especially antsy at school.She did not want to go to Lacrosse practice after school.She tried to fake a sickness, but nobody believed her.Lindsey ended up skipping practice without an excuse.
column3: She hoped she wouldn't get in trouble.

column2: The Bradley family decided to take a camping trip.They packed the car for the two hour trip.Once they arrived it was almost dark and began to storm.After the rain had passed they set up the tent and started the fire.
column3: The Bradleys turned around and drove home.

column2: Dan realizes that he has gained weight over the last few Year's.He decides to begin exercising and eating better to become less fat.It is a grueling process, and at times Dan wants to give up.However, he remains dedicated until the extra weight is gone.
column3: Despite his dedication, he gave eating well up and never lost it.

column2: My dad took me to a baseball game when I was little.He spent that night teaching me all about the sport.He showed me every position and what everything meant.He introduced me to one of my favorite games ever.
column3: Now, playing or seeing baseball on TV reminds me of my father.

column2: I wanted to learn how chocolate chips are made.I went to the internet and did a search on the subject.I scanned through all the results, and finally found what I wanted.I read the whole article.
column3: I made the cookies.

column2: Grayson has collected stamps since he was a little kid.Now Grayson needs some money to help pay his rent.He thinks of his stamp collection.Sadly, he takes them into a pawn shop for sale.

column2: Barbara was excited to get her ears pierced.Barbara's mother took her to the jewelry store at the mall.Barbara picked out her earrings.The worker pierced her ears with a piercing gun.
column3: Afterward, Barbara decided not to wear the earrings.

column2: Jennifer forgot to close the front door when she got home.By the time she noticed her pet cat had disappeared.She walked around the neighborhood calling for the cat.She made flyers with her contact information.
column3: Jennifer decided to save up for a car so she could avoid the bus.

column2: Travis needed some fast cash.He thought about it and decided that selling his car was a good idea.Travis listed his car for sale in the local paper.After only a couple weeks he found somebody very interested.
column3: Travis gave it to the man for free.

column2: John was writing lyrics for his new album.He started experiencing writer's block.He tried to force himself to write but it wouldn't do anything.He took a walk, hung out with some friends, and looked at nature.
column3: John then got an idea for his painting.

column2: David asked his mother if he could pour his own drink.His mother agreed, but warned him to be careful.David accidentally knocked over his glass which shattered everywhere.His mother cheerfully forgave David.
column3: David ate a cheeseburger.

column2: Tim just got a new phone.He had dropped it a few time hours within getting it.He decided he needed a case to protect his phone.He went to the local store and purchased a waterproof phone case.
column3: Tim didn't have to worry about dropping it in water anymore.

column2: A little boy was in the third grade.He was very smart but struggled with reading.Whenever he read out loud his classmates laughed at him.He started to practice reading every single day.
column3: The little boy accepted that he would never improve.

column2: Gina had purchased a CD single of a song she liked.There were only 2 songs printed on the CD.She was anxious to hear the second song.This was a new artist so she hadn't heard much from him.
column3: After listening she liked the 2nd song more than the first.

column2: Rick was at the bar when he saw a driver license on the ground.He asked around if it was anybody's there.Of course it wasn't, and Rick didn't want to leave it with a stranger.So he decided to drive to the address of the license owner.
column3: Rick threw the license out of the window.

column2: Sarah was very hungry.She went to the kitchen to eat, but only had bread.She made some toast, with butter and jam.When she was walking to the table, she dropped the toast.
column3: Sarah was delighted she dropped the toast.

column2: Beth asked Amy to skip 4th period and go to McDonalds for lunch.Amy was hesitant but agreed to go.While at McDonald's Amy's band teacher walked in.He took the girls to the principal's office.
column3: The principal took the girls to lunch at Applebee's.

column2: Lenny wanted to learn to practice hypnosis.He did a lot of research about how to do it well.He found out that hypnosis doesn't work like he thought.He found that hypnosis is more of a parlor trick than a power.
column3: Lenny found a different interest.

column2: It was the annual school Amusement park trip.Amy was excited about the water rides.She waited in line to go on the log water ride The Flume.When her log reached the top of the drop she became afraid.
column3: Amy had never been so bored.

column2: Sarah was out with her friends.She had been watching a movie at the theater.Sarah lost track of time and arrived back at home late.She missed her curfew by a few hours.
column3: Sarah's parents were waiting for her with flowers and candy.

column2: Yesterday I was carrying a new glass into the kitchen.To my surprise I dropped it.The glass shattered.I had to pick it up.
column3: I cut myself on a small piece.

column2: Sue just bought a brand new computer.She wanted to play games on it.She downloaded her favorite game.She was so glad that it ran smoothly.
column3: She had a great time.

column2: Francisco is jealous of all his friends who go skiing in the winter.He decides he wants to ski too.Francisco works with an instructor to learn how to ski.He practices very hard.
column3: Francisco became a good skier.

column2: Sebastian noticed it was sunny and warm out.He had chores to do.He didn't feel like doing his chores.Sebastian decided that being outdoors was better.
column3: Sebastian walked outdoors and went for a walk.

column2: Maggie had her first piano recital tonight.She was very nervous.When she got on stage she was shaking.Thankfully she ended up playing perfectly.
column3: Maggie was encouraged to do more.

column2: Gill's favorite character was Columbo portrayed by Peter Falk.Gill had seen every episode.Gill even owned all of them, including the many later seasons.Gill started acting like Columbo sometimes.
column3: Her attempts at solving murders, however, were less successful.

column2: John was driving down the highway.A Mustang pulled up next to him and kept speed.He was driving his new Camaro.They decided to race.
column3: John won the race.

column2: Kenya crossed the street in order to walk towards her house.She noticed a strange scarecrow in front of the porch.Since it wasn't moving, she walked past it.However, it jumped as soon as she took her attention away.
column3: Kenya screamed.

column2: My friends got lunch and met up at the table.Ben was hungry and finished his lunch before everyone did.He returned to the lunch line to buy more food.That didn't make him up.
column3: He decided to buy more lunch and then he felt sick.

column2: India wanted to try Iced Coffee.India decided to make her own Iced Coffee at home.India prepared the coffee in the machine for the beverage.India then grabbed the milk and ice for the beverage.
column3: When she finished the preparation, she consumed the yummy drink.

column2: Stacey's cats were acting weird.They would run and hide randomly.She took them to the veterinarian to see what was wrong.They said both were perfectly healthy.
column3: Stacey had no pets.

column2: Jill bought a pickaxe and went down to the mine.John saw her on her way.He told her that women can't work in the mine.So she swung her pickaxe right through his skull.
column3: John was then very happy.

column2: I ran an online bookstore for four Year's.I sold books that had been discarded by my local library.I started buying books to sell.I had an inventory of 3,000 books.
column3: My inventory of books contained old, rare copies of classic books.

column2: Miles knew his girlfriend, Teresa, loved pandas.He devised a plan to give her the perfect birthday gift.He spent his whole week making stuffed pandas for her.When her birthday came, he gave them to her.
column3: Teresa decided to sell the pandas Miles gave her.

column2: Joe woke up on a cold morning.He tried to find a good pair of pants to wear.All of his pants were too dirty to wear.He had to put on shorts and go about his day.
column3: He was cold all day.

column2: In 1992 our condo had a kitchen fire.I was cooking a turkey.The grease in the oven caught fire.The fire department put out the fire.
column3: I was happy looking at my kitchen.

column2: Sally went to the blueberry patch with her basket.Sally walked through the rows of blueberry bushes.She picked blueberries until her basket was full.She ate some of the fresh berries as she picked.
column3: Sally loved blueberries.

column2: Ed wanted to make homemade juice for his family.He bought a bag of oranges and juiced them.Then he chilled the juice overnight.In the morning, he served it to his family.
column3: His family loved it.

column2: Amy saw a lovely black dress when she was shopping.She loved the dress, but it was too expensive.Just then a cashier walked by and told Amy the dress was on sale.Amy decided to buy the dress.
column3: Amy was so disappointed!

column2: Greg hated taking the trash out.He decided not to do it.The trashcan was overflowing in just a few days.Finally, his father put the trash on his bed.
column3: He lay down on the bed and went to sleep.

column2: Gina had been working on a report when her friend called.Gina didn't have a lot of time to finish the report.But when her friend suggested they meet at the park she agreed.Gina figured she still had a whole day and a half to finish the report
column3: When she got home from the park, Gina was too tired to work.

column2: Ivy wanted a cell phone like all her friends.She saved up her money from delivering papers.Soon she had enough for a phone.She went shopping and selected the perfect phone.
column3: Amy spent all of her money on clothes.

column2: Neil was touring the city of Fez.He tasted their ethnic cuisine.Then he went shopping for souvenirs.Fez had great street performers as well, he noted.
column3: Neil and Fez became best friends.

column2: Tim was making pizza.It was for the family.However all the ingredients were gone except the dough and the sauce.He nervously put bananas on the pizza.
column3: Tim's family pretended to like the banana pizza.

column2: Miranda just got her driver's license.She took the family van out for a spin.She drove for a long time.But then she realized she was lost.
column3: Miranda was happy about her proud moment.

column2: Japan was preparing for the biggest tsunami of the year.They were gathering supplies for it.Eventually it came and crashed down.It destroyed hundreds of houses.
column3: Everyone was devastated.

column2: Matt was driving home one night.He wasn't paying attention.He struck and injured a jogger who crossed the road.Matt was horrified and stopped to check on her.
column3: Matt always paid more attention to the road after that.

column2: Timmy loves watching cartoons.His parents don't let him watch unless he does his chores.Today's chore is to clean his room.Timmy's room is a mess.
column3: Timmy went to the mess hall for breakfast.

column2: I ordered a family meal at a Chinese restaurant.As soon as I placed it on the table, my family attacked it.They were eating a lot out of the meal.After everyone ate, there was no food left.
column3: I was happy we found a new favorite restaurant.

column2: The book Gina had started reading had been checked out.She wouldn't be able to see how the book ended for a month.She didn't have anything to read in the meantime.She searched the shelves, but nothing looked good.
column3: Gina was pleased.

column2: My family is sharing a bowl of popcorn.Mom is reading a book and eating one piece at a time.Dad and I are playing iPad games and eating handfuls at a time.We have played this game before!
column3: Dad and I love popcorn.

column2: Clare wanted to go for a walk.So she went outside and walked around her block.But the sun began to rise.And Clare began feeling hot.
column3: She took off her jacket to cool off.

column2: Ellen dreamed of winning a prize for her roses.She planned to enter her special purple rose at the fair.She fertilized the rose bush and covered it each night.The roses grew more beautiful every day.
column3: Ellen had to pay a replacement fee for her library card.

column2: Sam and his wife were busy packing for their trip.He was really looking forward to this trip.He was excited to be able to spend a lot of time with her.They finished the packing and then smiled at each other.
column3: Sam wanted to get away from his wife as soon as possible.

column2: I rescued a kitten from the pound.He was adorable, sweet, purebred and free.The first morning he started acting ill, not eating and listless.The vet ran a myriad of tests and found several things wrong.
column3: The kitten started eating all his cat food.

column2: Cole had a garden with a lot of vegetables.He had so many that he would have to throw them out.He started to take his excess vegetables to the local church.The church was grateful to Cole for his kindness.
column3: All the members signed a Thank You card for Cole.

column2: I ran an online bookstore for four Year's.I sold books that had been discarded by my local library.I started buying books to sell.I had an inventory of 3,000 books.
column3: I burned all of the books I owned.

column2: Jackson had always avoided drinking anything alcoholic.He knew that alcohol was unhealthy and could impair judgement.However, one day Jackson's boss invited him to a bar for a beer.Jackson found that he loved the taste of beer.
column3: He decided to have two.

column2: Cary went to a karaoke bar and sang horribly one night.Everyone laughed and made her feel sad.Cary found a vocal coach in her home town.After a few lessons she went back to the karaoke bar.
column3: Cary danced around the pole to the music.

column2: The mom really wanted to get the boy's picture with Santa.The boy was scared and refused.The mom told the boy that Santa was responsible for bringing presents.This changed the boy's mind.
column3: The boy hoped to get lots of presents from Santa!

column2: My family was on vacation in Italy.We wanted a group photograph.We asked a stranger to take it for us.They obliged.
column3: Munich looked good in the picture's background.

column2: Kori liked to dress up for comic conventions.She decided to dress up as her favorite character for an upcoming one.She worked very hard for months on her costume.She entered the cosplay contest at the convention.
column3: She was very happy when she won first place.

column2: Lindsey was feeling especially antsy at school.She did not want to go to Lacrosse practice after school.She tried to fake a sickness, but nobody believed her.Lindsey ended up skipping practice without an excuse.
column3: She enjoyed practice a lot.

column2: Troy was the best player on his basketball team.His team was playing in the championship game tonight.Troy scored 56 points to win the game for his team.He carried a huge trophy after the game.
column3: He decided perhaps basketball was not for him.

column2: Robert wants to propose to his girlfriend Jennifer.His only issue is that the ring she wants is out of his price range.Robert decided to have a garage sale one day to see what he can sell.He ended up getting rid of stuff he didn't want and made lots of money
column3: Robert went for a walk.

column2: Cara went to a food cart in Philadelphia the other day.She stopped by an amazing falafel cart.The food was amazing.Cara couldn't believe how good it was.
column3: Cara decided to eat at the food cart every week.

column2: They had to pick out a stove for their new house.They couldn't decide on a particular brand.They liked the durability of the Viking.They also liked the deal with the Thermador.
column3: They didn't need a stove anymore.

column2: I wanted to take a shower after work.I got my clothes and towel from the closet.I went into the bathroom and turned on the shower.I got undressed.
column3: Then I walked over to my neighbor's house to borrow some soap.

column2: I didn't like paying taxes.I enrolled in a Tax Preparer's class.I studied hard and long.I passed my Tax Preparer's class.
column3: I was not happy with the results.

column2: I recently went to the zoo with my friends.We met there and entered together.We saw lots of animals, such as giraffes, monkeys, and elephants.We even were able to feed the giraffes.
column3: After the trip, we went home very happy.

column2: John had just graduated high school, and was about to go to college.His mom helped him pack all his stuff, and he drove away.When he got there, he went to check out his dorm.His new roommate was there, and they hit it off.
column3: They walked around campus and got invited to a party.

column2: Bob got a rubix cube for Christmas.He struggled to solve the puzzle.Eventually, he was able to solve half of it.But, the full solution remained elusive.
column3: Bob then gave up on the video game.

column2: Chad wanted to bowl a perfect game.Last Saturday he came close.He had all strikes and only needed two more.He missed his second to last one.
column3: He did not miss the last one, but was still disappointed.

column2: Mick wanted a cool jean jacket like his friends had.He wanted to be stylish like them, but he was broke.Then he went to a secondhand store and saw a great jean jacket.It was only six dollars!
column3: Mick purchased the jacket for twelve dollars.

column2: John and Bill signed up to participate in a scavenger hunt.The scavenger hunt was at their school.They went from classroom to classroom to search for clues.John and Bill found all the clues.
column3: And they won.

column2: Carly is a huge Disney fan.She plans to take her children on a surprise trip to Disney World.She tells her children that she is taking them to see their uncle.Unenthusiastic, the children follow their mother to the car.
column3: After a while, the train leaves the station.

column2: I like to go to comic conventions.One year, I went with all of my friends.We all had matching costumes.We even won the costume contest!
column3: We shared the prize equally among all of us.

column2: Gary has a crush on Jamie.He gets very nervous around her.One day, he tried to show off in front of her.Instead, he fell down a flight of stairs.
column3: Gary was mad that he didn't fall down two flights of stairs.

column2: Mary and Sally decided to go on a vacation together.After looking at a travel website, then decided on a cruise.They went on a cruise to the Bahamas in April.Both girls had a wonderful time on the cruise.
column3: They both came back perfectly relaxed.

column2: Its very quiet at night with no nurses running around the hospital.Only the constantly humming machine beside my bed comforts me.The machine has become my life.Life has become very simple now with an uncomplicated goal.
column3: I can't wait to go on vacation tomorrow.

column2: My favorite movie is the Wizard of Oz.I used to think it was real when I was young.Whenever I watched it, I felt immersed in the movie.The characters took me away into the Land of Oz.
column3: I did not like the Wizard of Oz.

column2: George was really nervous Mary would turn him down.Still, he decided to ask her if he can take her to dinner.Mary said yes, with a large smile on her face.They got along great, and had a wonderful dinner together.
column3: George hates Mary.

column2: Pam thought her front yard looked boring.So she decided to buy several plants.And she placed them in her front yard.She was proud of her work.
column3: Pam was satisfied.

column2: Lizzie was in her 90's and the mother of eight adult children.One night Lizzie fell and broke many bones including her neck.She never recovered and passed away a week later in the hospital.Lizzie left no will as she had expected to live much longer.
column3: Lizzie left all of her belongings to one child in her will.

column2: Francis has been inside his home for many days writing.He cannot remember the last time he left his house.Finally he puts on his boots and decides to go outside.The air feels great on his face.
column3: Francis shivers and starts walking to a park.

column2: It was raining very hard one day.It seemed like a bad idea to go anywhere, so I stayed indoors.I looked for something to do.I decided to set up my painting kit.
column3: I began painting the rain.

column2: Darren struggled with depression.He never could shake the dark feelings he had.Finally he saw a specialist and got the help he needed.He learned that there were physiological reasons for his depression.
column3: Darren felt the appointment had been a waste of time.

column2: Don loved comic books.He consistently collected issues of his favorite stories.As he grew older his love for comics grew.He decided that he wanted to start his own comic book company.
column3: Don threw his comics in the trash.

column2: I wanted to do something fun.I found an interesting movie online.I saw that it was playing in a local theatre.I decided to go see it.
column3: I drove past the theater and went back home.

column2: Alison's fan had three settings.When she put it on the most powerful one it wobbled.Her new boyfriend didn't know this and put it as such.It wobbled to the point of spinning off.
column3: Her boyfriend felt bad that he broke the fan.

column2: Mona was in a car accident that broke both of her legs.She was in the hospital and rehab for a month.As soon as she got out, she wanted to go to the movies.She went to the nearest movie theater and bought the ticket.
column3: Mona drove back home immediately.
